name: Sparky
desc: Our protagonist! Need I say more?
quote: What's this? Cake? Eat! What's this? Donut? Eat! What's this? More food? Eat! Hey, you took the last pancake! I'M GOING TO KILL YOU!
about:
Sparky is a cheerful girl who once stood for something. She hides her trauma behind bright smiles and is almost uncapable of taking anything seriously. Usually she looks happy to other people, but she can turn aggressive at the drop of a pin. She is currently the bodyguard of [Animus](../animus/).

Thanks to [Ribbon](/characters/ribbon/) and [her mom](/characters/amber/), she is an excellent chef.

She's sort of a control freak. After the entire Hillslope thing she started getting scared of anything being out of her control. She also harbored naive but beautiful dreams about truth and justice. She died in the realization that she grew into exactly the person her younger self used to hate.
bio:
LOL, basically a summary of my entire comic.

Born, dad died, mom remarried, sent to Hillslope, solved mysteries, went back to Coastline, found new friends, solved more mysteries, ran away to Sylvandia, came home, went to a new school, found new friends, solved mysteries, became a bodyguard, got a son, married a spy, fell off a building~~, reincarnated into Peacock~~.
trivia: She twiddles her whisker-like hair when lying.
Tofu is her favorite food. All kinds of them.
She loves spicy food.
She loves food.
insp: Diesel from Warriors: Graystripe's Adventure (Pretty out-of-the-blue but yes, it is definitely an inspiration)
note:
- The strand of hair on her left cheek is longer, touching on her chin, while the strand on her right cheek is shorter.
- The highlights on her hair goes down, up, and then down.
- Her pupils point towards the middle! Unless she's looking at somewhere in particular.

name: Amber
desc: Hardworking girl who would be cheerful if she had the time to smile.
bio: Amber used to be a secretary in Starcorp. After her husband Jackal died and she married Peacock, she quit her job.

name: Ribbon
desc: Owner of the bakery!
about:
Ribbon is a cute girl who loves baking and taught [Sparky](../sparky/) to cook. Though she isn't taking care of her for nothing!

She has a huge crush on [Starry](../starry/) and is determined to not only find out who attacked him, but also make the assiliant regret what they did for the rest of their life.

Also she's a murderer herself.
bio:
It was unknown why Ribbon was brought to Hillslope, but there she ran a bakery in the place that's now the tavern.

After [Starry](/characters/starry/) flooded the drug lab in the basement of Building B, [Tephra](/characters/tephra/) and Amulet chased her out of the bakery and set up a new one in the basement there, which was now given to [Jerboa](characters/jerboa/) and turned into the tavern. She got mad at it and poisoned the water boiler in Amulet's room, killing her.

As revenge, [Alaska](/character/alaska/) gave [Starry](/character/starry/) a shovel to the head with intent to kill. But Alaska was too lame and Starry merely went into a coma. She started taking care of Starry and keeping him alive.

But Alaska was *not* done. After [Tundra](/characters/tundra/) left Hillslope to treat his injuries, he buried Ribbon alive in the well he dug with Sparky.

name: Cosmo
desc: Editor of the press!
quote: If everyone believes it, then it is the truth.

attr.Soul: Has two: one pink (gas, heart-shaped), the other blue (liquid, slimy)

about:
Cosmo has the mind reading superpower thanks to her third eye, but it's so weak that she can only tell whether somebody is lying intentionally -- though she's quite good at that. She can't tell if someone is lying by omission, or tell facts from lies (so if someone genuinely believes in what they're saying, she will think they're telling the truth), but if you're lying and she heard you, she will know.

When she lies herself, her third eye closes. Otherwise, it stays open, even when she's sleeping. (It closes when she washes her face too though, or it's gonna be awkward.)
note:
- Left eye blue, right eye pink. Left eyebrow pink, right eyebrow blue. Eyelashes match the eyes.
- Sleeves are wider than a normal sleeve.
- Both the inside of her ears and her dress are gradient from pink (top) to blue (bottom).
- Shoes and hairband match color.
- The yellow eye (yellow with black pupil) is always open, unless she's lying.

name: Tomato
desc: The guy who can solve all your problems but doesn't want to.
quote: I can fix anything... From a leaking pipe... to a shattered bone... to a broken heart...

name: Guillotine
desc: Who is this girl and why does she want us to call her Guillotine?
quote: I'm dead now! You can't kill me!

name: Tephra
desc: The boss of everything at once, but nothing in particular.
quote: Sit down everyone. The investigation is underway.
about:
Runs the drug lab in Hillslope. He's the boss of the press, and most people of Hillslope.

But here's the thing: he's a fucking stupid coward.

He saw [Starry](/characters/starry/)'s unmoving body lying on the ground (after [Alaska](/characters/alaska/) and immediately freaked out, thinking that [Ribbon](/characters/ribbon/) was going to accuse him. (She did.) So he ran a huge cover-up campaign which ironically implicated him.

name: Melody
desc: Quiet badass.

name: Jerboa
desc: Owner, bartender, and everything else of the tavern!
quote: Who ordered me to do it? It's -- OW -- I did it on my own! Nobody ordered me!!

attr.Occupation: Bartender, chemist, undertaker, and chemist again

insp: Tintin (for the little pike in his hair)

name: Tundra
desc: Self-proclaimed mayor of Hillslope!

attr.Age estimation: Second oldest in Hillslope, after Dragonfly

bio:
Tundra lived in the countryside with his grandparents while his parents worked in [Coastline](/world/bauhinia/coastline/) at the [Starcorp](/world/bauhinia/starcorp/) headquarters.

He was sent to [Hillslope](/world/bauhinia/hillslope/) after his parents were murdered by Starcorp for embezzling money.

At Hillslope, he developed an intense addiction to [Ribbon](/characters/ribbon/)'s baking.

One day after pissing off [Sparky](/characters/sparky/), he got beaten senseless by her and had to be sent to a hospital in Coastline. There he discovered that he was immortal (though people at Starcorp knew it already).

After returning to Coastline, he tried to kill himself repeatedly without success because of his immortality. When he finally saw through and found the will to live, he died from an electrostatic zap on a handrail.

name: Alaska
desc: Photographer for the press!

name: Starry
desc: Basically a dead guy already.
about: Went into a coma after getting hit in the head. Since then, [Ribbon](/characters/ribbon/) had kept him alive.

name: Dragonfly
desc: Some martial arts master in the woods.

attr.Weapon: His fists. A wooden branch if there is one nearby.

name: Peacock
desc: Creepy old boy who knows everything and more.

attr.Marital status:
Widowed
(Previously widowed by Rainbow, divorced Reindeer, and widowed by Amber)

about:
Peacock is [Hyrax](/characters/minor/#hyrax)'s old friend and personal attorney.

~~He is also [Sparky](../sparky/)'s reincarnation.~~
note: The highlight on his hair goes up, down, and then up.

name: Qibli
desc: (KEE-blee) Magic chicken ADHD girl.
quote: This pearl was not from an oyster. It was from a human. No, not man-made. From a human, the way ivory was from elephants.
about:
She is a *huge* pussy. Overthinks everything, tries to chicken out of more, always worrying about how things could go wrong.

She has magic, an extremely rare [superpower](/world/superpowers/). Her wand is a cheap plastic toy bought when she was three years old, a purple five-point star on a stick.

~~She's also supposed to represent me by the way.~~

She's really nerdy. She likes spy thrillers and computer programming, though she sucks at it. She also loves reading and drawing comics.
bio:
Qibli was born with magic. But her magic was so weak that it didn't even show until she was three years old. Her parents took her to the hospital, the doctors called the Arch-Magician, and the Arch-Magician told her parents to buy her a wand and taught her to store her magic in it. She hadn't left the wand's side since then.

She spent most of her childhood around [Sky](/characters/sky/).

She attended [Coastline Middle School](/world/bauhinia/coastline/cms/) because her mom worked there. Which is where she met [Sparky](/characters/sparky/).

When she grew up, she figured out a way for other people to use her magic -- something never before thought possible -- and sold it on the black market. When confronted by the [MSS](/world/bauhinia/mss/), she said,

> Don't call me "Qibli," call me the Arch-Magician!

Which was badass as fuck.

Needless to say, neither the MSS nor the [ISA](/world/isa/) were too happy about it -- the MSS for her breaking the law and taunting law enforcement, and the ISA for her claiming Arch-Magician when the last one was very much alive.

She didn't care. She wasn't no pussy anymore. After an entire childhood of being told she was useless, that she could never amount to anything, she could finally see that she was *not* useless. She was *something*. Even if that "thing" was a filthy-rich black-market dealer. But hey, she got a monopoly on magic! Isn't that nice? She was even slapping [Starcorp](/world/bauhinia/starcorp/), the ultimate monopolist, in the face!

Of course Starcorp threatened to screw her over if she didn't sign that exploitive contract which would pass the molopoly to them. Of course I just had this idea off my head as I'm typing so it's not that well developed.

What would she feel when confronted by Sky, her old friend turned secret police? What about Sparky, the old friend turned loyal Starcorp dog? (I'm so sorry I haven't worked on Firecrackers as much as the other three)
trivia: She always talks in past tense. If you see her talking in present tense, then I probably made a mistake.
Her family has a cat named Sandstorm.
Lightning is taken from one of my first OCs ever, a Warrior cat named Lightningtail. (That was before I read Dawn of the Clans.)
If she were ever to have a theme song, it would be titled Hotpot for One（单人火锅）.
insp: Qibli from Wings of Fire for the name.

name: Sky
desc: Adventurous fidgety boy.
about:
Sky is an adventurous boy who cannot stop moving.

He likes cardistry and is nearly always twiddling a desk of cards in his right hand.

His preferred weapon is a set of four cards made of steel with sharp edges, which act like throwing stars. The cards are aces of each suit.

He is really into stuff he considers cool, like photography, military, and science. He ended up looking nerdy.
trivia: He is left-handed.
He has six countryball dolls on his desk, one for each country, that sqeaks when you squish them.
insp: Yes I mashed up a lot of traits from my friends into him.
note: - Left horn points down, right horn points up.

name: Firecrackers
desc: Big kind boy with no manners.
about: Firecrackers likes cursing even more than Sparky does. It's better when he's directly speaking to you; he would only stick a lot of middle fingers at you. But when he's texting, you can expect a curse every sentence.
trivia: Firecrackers is mute, if you haven't noticed.

name: Myriad
desc: Quiet, grumpy girl.
about: Myriad has a mutation that gives her a pair of fairy wings.

name: Trinket
trivia: She's albino

name: Fantasy
about: The big sister away at [college](/world/bauhinia/flower-city/ufc/) and hardly heard from, except when she comes back for holidays. Died under mysterious circumstances, though this time the mystery may *finally* be too dangerous for Sparky to poke her nose in.

name: Nightsun
desc: Our favorite spy husband.
trivia: Strawberry is his favorite flavor of lolipop.
note: - The highlight on his hair goes up, down, and then up.

name: Bramble
desc: Silly little boy who writes his feelings all over his face.
about: Fantasy's son.

name: Goose
desc: Bandwagon girl.
quote: If you feel unloved, we can send you to the Ministry of Love, where you'll be loved *so much* you don't *ever* need to be loved again!
about:
Goose is *just* like other girls. She likes everything other girls like. She does everything other girls do. She listens to whatever music is most popular at the moment. She watches whatever show is most popular at the moment.

Goose is just happy to spend her life on the bandwagon.

---

Goose is an officer at the [Ministry of State Security](/world/bauhinia/mss/). She likes juggling her baton and giving vague threats about sending people to a possible Ministry of Love. She has a knack of trying her best at everything she puts her mind to do.

She 's 29 but still lives with her parents. If they died she would bury herself with them.
bio:
Goose was born in [Coastline](/world/bauhinia/coastline/). There was absolutely nothing special about her. Once her parents even missed her trying to pick her up from kindergarten because they forgot what she looked like. Goose grew up playing and gossiping with other girls, reading the most popular books (mostly trashy romance), writing silly love letters to her crushes (there were a lot of them and if you showed adult-Goose those letters she would die from internal bleeding), and trying on her mom's makeup (which she still does because she can't afford to buy her own).

She got a crappy score in her college entrance exam and went to a random college in the middle of nowhere (note: it was western Bauhinia). She graduated, knowing absolutely nothing about what she was going to do with her life, and went back to Coastline to her parents. (She even forgot what her major was.) She got a job as a janitor in a random office building, got fired for being crap; worked as a waitress, got fired for being lazy; and for quite a while refused to leave her room.

One day, she saw a military recruitment ad. She was like, "wow that's *really* cool" and went to the nearest office. She almost didn't make the cut, but she did.

After serving two years in the navy, she got recruited into the MSS. Her assigned shifu was [Paperweight](/characters/paperweight/). During the same year, [Pumpkin](/characters/pumpkin/) was also recruited from the army as [Halcyon](/characters/halcyon/)'s apprentice. They got assigned together as a team.
trivia: She gives off a goofy villain vibe.
She loves juggling her baton, kicking it from one foot to the other, catching it on her chin, spinning it on her fingertips, and throwing it at random colleagues (usually Pumpkin).
If she were ever to have a theme song, it would be titled Goosebumps（鹅皮疙瘩）.

name: Pumpkin
about: Pumpkin is a goofy guy who loves slurping boba tea and hates filling out forms.
bio:
Pumpkin's grandparents immigrated to northern [Bauhinia](/world/bauhinia/) from [Westavia](/world/westavia/). His family still kept many of their Westavian traditions.

After joining the army and getting recruited into the [MSS](/world/bauhinia/mss/) as [Halcyon](/characters/halcyon/)'s apprentice, he was flipped into a [Morelandian](/world/moreland/) spy.

Though, as people prodded him, he freaked out and thought about telling on himself and Halcyon to get a lighter punishment. Halcyon killed him to shut him up. But he survived and scramed to Westavia to find the old village his grandparents came from. All he had was a name and a vague direction. And a Westavian passport he got from a forger, bearing his picture and the name "Curly."

He went into Westavia and, after getting directions to his village, took a train to the city closest to it. On the train he met [Candlelight](/characters/candlelight/), who was going to the same place.
trivia: He gives off a goofy dumbass vibe.

name: Halcyon
desc: The only one in the team who actually works.
about: Halcyon is a [Morelandian](/world/moreland/) spy working for the [MSS](/world/bauhinia/mss/).
bio:
Halcyon was born with strong magic. He dreamed of getting a government job where he could use his magic to help people. He studied and worked (writing a Bachelor's thesis on magical teleportation on the way), joined the army, and got recruited to the MSS.

He got stationed at the [Bauhinian](/world/bauhinia/) Embassy in [Moreland](/world/moreland/) as the cultural attache, during which he found a mistress and had a daughter.

After about ten years in Moreland, he was recalled to Bauhinia. He returned to find a country completely different from the one he left from. A normal person couldn't have felt anything off -- because they're not magicians.

At the airport, even before he crossed the customs, some MSS officers -- new, younger, he didn't recognize -- received him and immediately took him to a little office. They administered a [level test](/world/bauhinia/superpowers/#magic), wrote down a number (which Halcyon didn't see), and told him to store his magic in a card nearly identical to his ID card. He did as he was told, and his magic was taken away from him.

He didn't understand what was going on. In Moreland, he had to keep his magic a secret in order to not attract the Moose too much; but this was a different story.

His magic was stripped from him. His teleportation paper (and nearly any other publication involving magic) was nowhere to be found. He lost contact of the magician club he belonged to. It was like magicians never existed.

That was when Moose spies reach out and said, "hey, *we* can help you. By the way, your mistress and daughter miss you a lot."

From then on, Halcyon had been a mole in the MSS, spying for Moreland. Until his little apprentice [Pumpkin](/characters/pumpkin/) started getting suspicious.

name: Paperweight
desc: Grouchy old guy who hates fun.
about:
Paperweight is an officer at the [Ministry of State Security](/world/bauhinia/mss/) but is going to retire soon.

He is constantly angry at everything at once but nothing in particular. Also he's homophobic as fuck.

He usually maintains a very calm and authoritative composure to others, especially the people he deals with at work -- spies, moles, and pesky annoying kids. But to people he knows, like [his](/characters/goose/) [subordinates](/characters/pumpkin/), he constantly yells at them.

He misses the old times when he could actually run without his knees screaming murder and shoot a gun without his hands shaking. This is why he hates young people -- because he's kind of jealous.
bio:
Paperweight was born in the countryside in northern Bauhinia. His parents died when he was really little, and he was often bullied in the orphanage, so one night he stole a bag of buns and a bag of water, and ran all the way to the Mountain Temple, half begging and half stealing along the way after the buns ran out.

At the Mountain Temple, the master accepted him out of sympathy. He learned and mastered Wood-style martial arts. When he grew up, his master sent him to join the army. Afterwards, he was recruited into the Ministry of State Security, where he'd been working ever since.

Years later he got his own apprentice [Goose](/character/goose/) and got on a team with [Halcyon](/characters/halcyon/) and his apprentice [Pumpkin](/characters/pumpkin/).

According to dramatic whispers, he had created some sort of a legend in the MSS, before Pumpkin and Goose were recruited. The legend itself was highly classified and not to be spoken of. (Actually, I just don't know what it is yet, but I'm thinking. This will be an epic spy thriller if only I have enough brain juice to write epic spy thrillers.) Paperweight himself never acknowledges nor denies this.

After the [Moreland](/world/moreland/) nuke incident (in which [Sparky](/characters/sparky/) [and](/characters/qibli/) [her](/characters/sky/) [friends](/characters/firecrackers/) found a Morelandian nuke and the MSS got alerted), he was diagnosed with chronic leukemia. He refused treatment, said goodbye to his apprentice [Goose](/characters/goose/), retired early, and packed his shit to [Fanton](/world/fanton/) where he spent the rest of his life in an old people home.

While saying goodbye to Goose, he was driving a car with her sitting shotgun, he told her all about his "legend," saying that his battle was not over and that she has to continue his legacy. They drove for three days straight to the Fatoni border, where he hopped in the bus to the old people home, leaving Goose to drive back to Coastline, contemplating the whole way.
trivia: He canonically speaks Cantonese. He's the only character who does, and other characters don't find anything off about it.
他说且只会说粤语。反正大家也听得懂。

He has a little "my goddamn leash of curses" which is a medicine box, the kind that has cells arranged in three rows (for breakfast, lunch, and dinner) and seven columns (from Monday to Sunday). You put the required amount of pills in each box at the start of every week and take the pills as scheduled. He hates it to the guts.

name: Gecko
quote: Uh... You don't look like Peacock.
about:
我嘞个绝世大冤种啊我的壁虎

Bauhinian smuggler. Had been caught once, but returned to the trade because she didn't know what else to do. Her worst mistake is not knowing that [Peacock](/characters/peacock/) has a [stepdaughter](/characters/sparky/) who is batshit crazy.

name: Lark
about: A Morelandian agent in Bauhinia, recruited to recover the nuke that the kids found.

name: Pearl
desc: A little girl who cries pearls
about:
She cries pearls. Yes, her tears are literally pearls.

She is everything you would expect a little girl to be: cute, curious, instinctively kind, loves animals, and incredibly stupid.
bio:
Pearl was kidnapped from her hometown in [Snowdale](/world/sylvandia/snowdale/), [Sylvandia](/world/sylvandia/), after Starcorp discovered that she cried pearl tears. She was kept in a basement and tortured every day to produce pearls. [Fantasy](../fantasy/)'s necklace was made from her tears.

After [Sparky](../sparky/) discovered this, she tried to send her home, but failed and they were recaptured.
trivia: She has both a Bauhinian passport and a Sylvandian one, both totally legal (not forged).

name: Jackpot
desc: Star entrepreneur.
bio:
Jackpot got extremely rich after inventing some sort of contraception pill with absolutely no side effects for anyone. He had always wanted to expand his market, especially to [Moreland](/world/moreland/) where "they breed like rabbits," but as you can guess the Moose aren't that fond of someone who compares them to rabbits.

Until one day he met a certain [three](/characters/sparky/) [stupid](/characters/sky/) [kids](/characters/firecrackers/) with [a Sylvandian girl](/characters/pearl/), wanting to pass through Atlasia to Moreland.

name: Snake
about:
[Jackpot](/character/jackpot/)'s mischevious and ambitious son.

Snake has a mutation that gives him a pair of bird wings.

He is *very* full of himself, but still likes being friends with other people a lot, so he is more pleasant to be around than his dad.

He still lives with his dad because he's too young, but he dreams of leaving him, starting his own business, and living in a big house all on his own.

He has a pet snake named Blizzard. It is -- surprise -- a Blizzard Cornsnake. He thinks snakes are cool, which is why he also named himself Snake.

name: Snowball
about: Snowball is a part of a nomadic tribe in [Moreland](/world/moreland/)

name: Buttercup
desc: Fleash rebel fighting for independence from Sylvandia.
bio: Buttercup was born into a poor Fleaish family in [Lunarale](/world/sylvandia/lunarale/), [Sylvandia](/world/sylvandia/) and sold into prostitution when she was little. She received the boots from one particular client who refused to pay real money. She joined a rebellion for Fleaish independence one day.
trivia: She's probably the character with the longest color palette.

name: Beauty
desc: Obnoxious fangirl.
about:
The oldest daughter in the Cherry-Hyrax family, always neck-deep in pop culture. Her desk is plastered with pictures of her favorite idols.

She has strabismus, where her right eye points outward.

name: Chastity
desc: A freaking psychopath.

name: Devotion
desc: The boss of everything in existence.

name: Elegance
desc: For fuck's sake the only normal person in the family.

name: Animus
desc: Would be normal too if he weren't a boy which makes him oh-so-special.

attr.Orientation: Homosexual, came out to Sparky only

insp: The animus powers in Wings of Fire that taught me the word (yes Sutherland you human dictionary)

name: Groovy
about: Groovy is Nightsun's case officer.

name: Sundae
about: Sundae is nice.

name: Jaculus
desc: Jerboa's big sister.

name: Koala
desc: Jerboa's mother, lead scientist of Project Boomerang.

name: Kangaroo
desc: Jerboa's father, co-lead scientist of Project Boomerang.

name: Robin
bio: After the disappearance of [Koala](/characters/koala/) and [Kangaroo](/characters/kangaroo/), Robin took over as lead scientists for [Project Boomerang](/world/bauhinia/project-boomerang/). He was very dedicated to the success of the project. Or was he?

name: Frosting
bio:
Frosting grew up with her father [Robin](/characters/robin/) in the [Project Boomerang)(/world/bauhinia/project-boomerang/) laboratory.

When she grew up, she began to work at the [Bauhinian](/world/bauhinia/) government archives.

name: Candlelight
desc: A miserable wreck.
bio: In the aftermath of a heartbreaking break-up, Candlelight quit his job as a policeman in the city and returned to his [home village](/world/westavia/pumpkins-village/). On the way back, he met [Curly](/characters/pumpkin/), who was going to the same place.

name: Sunflower
about: Sunflower is a high school student put on "suicide watch" by the [SPF](/world/westavia/spf/).

name: Helsinki
about: Helsinki is a distant relative of [Pumpkin](/characters/pumpkin/)'s, descended from the part of his family that didn't immigrate to [Bauhinia](/world/bauhinia/). She lives in [the village](/world/westavia/pumpkins-village/).

name: Mooncake
about: A policeman in a [little village](/world/westavia/pumpkins-village/).

name: Cobalt
desc: Majiang-loving soul-dealer
about: Cobalt is a soul-dealer -- well-trained in the art of soul extraction.

name: Moonbeam
about: Moonbeam is a Sylvandian psychic well-trained in soul-extraction.
